channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Europe’s ability to attract investment and create jobs is at its lowest in 9 years—and the U.S. is partly to blame
item.description: France, U.K., and Germany had the most foreign projects—but there was a double-digit decline in the number of projects in each country, EY found.

item.title: Trump’s Visit Makes a Splash in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Many Saudis say they are big fans of President Trump, calling him a “straight shooter” who shares their values. Others were not impressed.

item.title: The two female CEOs behind Foot Locker and Dick’s Sporting Goods’ $2.4 billion deal
item.description: If Mary Dillon couldn't fix Foot Locker, why will Dick's Sporting Goods?

item.title: Microsoft wants its AI Copilot app to lure Gen Z from rivals by behaving like a therapist
item.description: Microsoft's head of AI, Mustafa Suleyman, wants to build an AI assistant with emotional intelligence.

item.title: 70% of neurodiverse adults say they’re facing increased stigma at work, and the ongoing corporate rollback of DEI programs could make the situation worse
item.description: Stigmas are holding some neurodivergent employees back from getting the accommodations they need.

item.title: Cable Giants Charter and Cox to Merge in $34.5 Billion Deal
item.description: The combination, which must pass muster with antitrust authorities, would create one of the biggest TV and internet providers in the United States.

item.title: Novo Nordisk to Replace C.E.O. After Losing Edge in Weight-Loss Drugs
item.description: The Danish drugmaker, which makes Ozempic and Wegovy, has seen its stock tumble as competition in the weight-loss drug market has grown fiercer.

item.title: Trump Administration Live Updates: Republicans’ Sweeping Domestic Policy Bill Is in Peril
Novo ousts CEO Jorgensen after Lilly competition hits shares
item.description: Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen's departure follows a 53% decline in Novo Nordisk's share price over the past 12 months and growing competition from Eli Lil...

item.title: Data Centers’ Hunger for Energy Could Raise All Electric Bills
item.description: Individuals and small businesses may end up bearing some of the cost of grid upgrades needed for large electricity users, a new report found.

item.title: Trump’s Visit Makes a Splash in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Many Saudis say they are big fans of President Trump, calling him a “straight shooter” who shares their values. Others were not impressed.

item.title: Chris Brown Ordered to Remain in Custody After Arrest in England
item.description: The singer was charged with grievous bodily harm over a 2023 incident in London. He was ordered to remain in custody until June 13.

item.title: Trump Says ‘People Are Starving’ in Gaza and the U.S. Wants to Help
item.description: Humanitarian support has collapsed in the enclave, which has been under total Israeli blockade for more than two months. Aid groups warn that the terr...

item.title: Ukrainian Man, Roman Lavrynovych, Appears in Court Over Fires at Keir Starmer’s Properties
item.description: Roman Lavrynovych, 21, was charged with committing arson at two properties and a car with connections to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Studies of Breast Cancer and Other Diseases Threatened by New Policy
item.description: N.I.H. restrictions on payments to foreign partners may jeopardize research into conditions that would benefit Americans.
